channel.title: Draw Muhammed Day!
channel.description:
Sorry I was planning to post something like this earlier but I had exams.
The 'free' press is paralyzed by fear. They fear for their lives and the lives of their employees, I don't blame them, I blame those who threaten them. We cannot rely on the press to uphold our freedom of speech, a grassroots approach is needed.
Hence, on the [b]20th May 2010[/b] we will hold the first annual Draw Muhammad Day. Take a piece of paper, draw something and call it Muhammad, stick it in a public place with a message explaining why you did it.
Ever since the Danish cartoons incident, the media has been censoring itself in fear that if it were to somehow insult Islam, innocent people would be harmed. This kind of censorship is much more dangerous than government censorship, as it is much harder to fight, since there is no single entity responsible, but rather millions of individuals. The creator of "Draw Muhammed Day" is trying to combat the huge amount of self-censorship (mostly in the media) by getting many people to stand up to the threats of the extremists by stating that they refuse to live in fear of even sometimes well-backed-up threats anymore.
Very recently, the cartoon South Park showed Muhammad apparently dressed up as a bear, (which then turned out to be Santa Clause) and its producers received death threats. Even though this is mostly an American issue, I feel the need to stand by in solidarity.
Now before anyone erects the predictable canard "this offends Muslims, don't do it". Consider this. If you believe taxes should go up, but someone else believes they should go down, you would have a discussion about it and nobody would feel offended. After all its good for society if both sides put forward their cases and the best one is chosen. Same for everything else, voting Labour or Conservative, Democrat or Republican, Windows or Linux. We have laws to protect people but not ideas. Ideas survive or sink in the open discussion forum we call society. Discussion of an idea being offensive to some people is not grounds for that discussion to be censored.
links: [url=http://reason.com/assets/mc/mmoynihan/2010_04/1271980832-drawmohammedposter.jpg]image that started it all[/url] http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z7ok4njJXI8 - video explaining why this is important http://www.facebook.com/pages/Everybody-Draw-Mohammed-Day/121369914543425 - facebook group http://www.drawmuhammadday.com/

item.title: Draw Muhammed Day!
item.dc:creator: @g-stringer g-stringer
item.description:
@g-stringer wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:48, topic:340612”][quote author=g-stringer link=topic=436978.msg3217073#msg3217073 date=1274767156]

We set out to show what idiots they really are. Job done.

Why? Looks equally as idiotic from here.
I thought the point was that both sides had the right to be so.

[quote]Now, I have a simple question for you guys. Am I as free as you? May I practice my Freedom of Speech too?
Let’s research critically about the Holocaust then.[/quote]

The answer is yes, right? Don’t fall to their level etc.

Denying the holocaust is only something uptight americans or muslims could do, it is not something you can compare to drawing muhammed as they are completely different subjects. I am surprised this is their only response, I expected at least one Yakman dyeing or some bomb exploding.
[/quote]

The fact that this didn’t happen is a victory for the secular enlightened world. The most major thing that happened was that the Pakistani government banned facebook, youtube, wikipedia and about 400 other sites.

I feel they should be perfectly free to deny the holocaust if they want. After all, just because you have freedom of speech doesn’t mean you’re intelligent, thoughtful or even correct in what you say.

I’m personally against the laws banning holocaust denial in Germany, Austria and France. If you want to make yourself look stupid by denying the holocaust, I’m not one to stop you.

The point here is that we won’t issue death threats because they’ve denied the holocaust. We are confident enough that we don’t need to kill those who disagree with us.[/quote]

I quoted this merely for the fact that it is beautifully said. You basically summed up freedom of speech and the rights that come along with it, and how everyone should look at it. rep++

EDIT: that is if I could rep++, you owe this on me.

Read full topic

item.title: Draw Muhammed Day!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“g-stringer, post:40, topic:340612”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=436978.msg3216927#msg3216927 date=1274752483]

We set out to show what idiots they really are. Job done.

Why? Looks equally as idiotic from here.
I thought the point was that both sides had the right to be so.

[quote]Now, I have a simple question for you guys. Am I as free as you? May I practice my Freedom of Speech too?
Let’s research critically about the Holocaust then.[/quote]

The answer is yes, right? Don’t fall to their level etc.
[/quote]

Denying the holocaust is only something uptight americans or muslims could do, it is not something you can compare to drawing muhammed as they are completely different subjects. I am surprised this is their only response, I expected at least one Yakman dyeing or some bomb exploding.[/quote]

The fact that this didn’t happen is a victory for the secular enlightened world. The most major thing that happened was that the Pakistani government banned facebook, youtube, wikipedia and about 400 other sites.

I feel they should be perfectly free to deny the holocaust if they want. After all, just because you have freedom of speech doesn’t mean you’re intelligent, thoughtful or even correct in what you say.

I’m personally against the laws banning holocaust denial in Germany, Austria and France. If you want to make yourself look stupid by denying the holocaust, I’m not one to stop you.

The point here is that we won’t issue death threats because they’ve denied the holocaust. We are confident enough that we don’t need to kill those who disagree with us.

[quote=“Mopman, post:44, topic:340612”]I love how you guys are all about critical analysis until it’s something you believe in.

The worm has turned ;)[/quote]

Yes you’re right that this is a big problem with the world. People mostly research subjects not to gain wisdom but to reconfirm their own beliefs.

Read full topic

item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Lol BNP.

Hey terrorists – terrorise this!

And I agree with Niall. I thought it was about saying a big ‘fuck you!’ to people who play on the fact that some people are scared of being blown up, anthraxed, or stoned to death. I don’t really care if people deny the holocaust though, so they still lose in my opinion.
